speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me when the fever started after giving birth?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started about 2 days after delivery, I think it was around 36 hours after giving birth, I wasn't really paying attention to the time but I've been feeling a bit off since then."

speaker: Doctor
text: Did the fever start immediately after delivery or a few hours later?

speaker: Patient
text: "It was a bit later, I'd say a few hours after the baby was born, maybe around 4 or 5 hours, but I wasn't keeping track. It was just a slight temperature increase, not really thinking much of it at the time."

speaker: Doctor
text: Has the fever been constant or does it come in waves?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's been more of an intermittent thing, it comes and goes, but it's been a bit more frequent lately. It's usually when I'm feeling a bit more uncomfortable, like when I'm standing or moving around."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any discharge from your vagina that smells bad? REQUEST TEST: Complete blood count (CBC)

speaker: Doctor
text: Is the abdominal pain getting worse or staying the same? REQUEST TEST: Urine analysis

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Abdominal pain staying the same.

speaker: Doctor
text: Are you experiencing chills with the fever? Has the abdominal pain spread beyond your lower abdomen?

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't really feel like I'm shivering, but I do feel a bit warm, especially when I'm lying down. As for the pain, it's mostly confined to the lower part of my abdomen, but it's not sharp, more of a dull ache, like a heaviness."

speaker: Doctor
text: The pain has spread to my back and I feel very weak. Has the fever reached 102°F? DIAGNOSIS READY: Postpartum endometritis and possible sepsis.
